snippet: After a death during a non-Nascar race, the racing body addressed the issue of drivers’ leaving their cars after crashes.
abstract: Nascar announces new rules requiring drivers to stay in their racecars after accidents until safety workers arrive; shift comes as investigators continue to search for answers in the death of driver Kevin Ward Jr during sprint race.

byline.contributor: Matt Slovin contributed reporting from Brooklyn, Mich.

lead_paragraph: After a death during a non-Nascar race, the racing body addressed the issue of drivers’ leaving their cars after crashes.

headline.main: Responding to Death on a Track, Nascar Orders Drivers to Stay in Their Cars
